title: Engine
description: The engine is the heart of the vehicle, responsible for generating power by burning fuel and providing the necessary force to propel the car.

title: Transmission
description: The transmission is a crucial component that controls the power generated by the engine and manages the speed and torque of the vehicle.

title: Brake System
description: The brake system includes components such as brake pads, rotors, and calipers, responsible for slowing down and stopping the car when needed.

title: Suspension System
description: The suspension system enhances the car's ride comfort and handling by absorbing shocks and vibrations from the road surface.

title: Tires
description: Tires provide traction and grip on the road, contributing to the overall stability and performance of the vehicle.

title: Battery
description: The battery stores electrical energy and provides power to start the engine and operate electrical components when the car is not running.

title: Alternator
description: The alternator generates electrical power to recharge the battery and supply electricity to the car's electrical systems while the engine is running.

title: Starter Motor
description: The starter motor is responsible for turning the engine over during the ignition process, initiating the combustion cycle.

title: Fuel Pump
description: The fuel pump delivers fuel from the gas tank to the engine, ensuring a consistent and proper supply for combustion.

title: Radiator
description: The radiator helps regulate the engine temperature by dissipating heat from the coolant, preventing the engine from overheating.

title: Exhaust System
description: The exhaust system guides and filters the gases produced during the combustion process and helps reduce emissions while minimizing noise.

title: Catalytic Converter
description: The catalytic converter reduces harmful emissions by converting pollutants into less harmful substances before they exit the exhaust system.

title: Ignition System
description: The ignition system produces the spark needed to ignite the air-fuel mixture in the engine cylinders, starting the combustion process.

title: Air Filter
description: The air filter cleans the air entering the engine, removing dust and debris to ensure optimal combustion and engine performance.

title: Oil Filter
description: The oil filter removes impurities from the engine oil, preventing contaminants from damaging engine components and ensuring lubrication efficiency.

title: Power Steering Pump
description: The power steering pump provides hydraulic assistance to make steering easier for the driver, improving vehicle maneuverability.

title: Drive Belt
description: The drive belt connects and powers various engine components, such as the alternator, water pump, and power steering pump.

title: Timing Belt
description: The timing belt synchronizes the rotation of the engine's camshaft and crankshaft, ensuring proper engine timing and smooth operation.

title: Thermostat
description: The thermostat regulates the engine temperature by controlling the flow of coolant, helping maintain optimal operating conditions.

title: Oxygen Sensor
description: The oxygen sensor monitors the oxygen level in the exhaust gases, providing feedback to the engine control module for efficient fuel combustion.

title: Spark Plugs
description: Spark plugs generate the spark needed to ignite the air-fuel mixture in each engine cylinder, facilitating combustion and power generation.

title: Distributor
description: The distributor distributes electrical current to the spark plugs, coordinating the ignition timing for each cylinder in older ignition systems.

title: Ignition Coil
description: The ignition coil amplifies the electrical voltage from the battery, creating a high-energy spark for the spark plugs to ignite the fuel mixture.

title: Wheel Bearings
description: Wheel bearings allow the wheels to rotate smoothly on the axles, reducing friction and contributing to the overall handling and performance of the vehicle.

title: Shocks and Struts
description: Shocks and struts absorb and dampen vibrations and shocks from the road, providing a smoother ride and better vehicle stability.

title: Steering Rack
description: The steering rack converts the rotational motion of the steering wheel into lateral motion to control the direction of the front wheels.

title: Control Arms
description: Control arms connect the suspension system to the vehicle frame and support the wheels, contributing to the stability and alignment of the car.

title: Ball Joints
description: Ball joints connect the control arms to the steering knuckles, allowing for the movement of the suspension and steering systems.

title: Fuel Injector
description: Fuel injectors deliver precise amounts of fuel into the engine cylinders, ensuring efficient combustion and optimal engine performance.

title: EGR Valve
description: The EGR valve recirculates a portion of exhaust gases back into the engine cylinders, reducing nitrogen oxide emissions and controlling combustion temperature.
